text: William Denby "Bill" Hanna (July 14, 1910 - March 22, 2001) was an American animator, director, producer and co-founder with Joseph Barbera of Hanna- Barbera. The studio made well-known cartoons, such as Tom and Jerry, The Huckleberry Hound Show, The Flintstones, The Jetsons, and Scooby-Doo, as well as the musical movie, Charlotte's Web. title: William Hanna
